loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Patrona Márquez está renovando su credikiva porque requiere ahora mejorar mucho mas su cocina para ofrecer un servicio de excelencia a sus inquilinas, así ella correrá una pared y repellará las habitaciones que tiene arrendadas. . Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva “Estoy muy agradecida con las personas que me apoyaron en mi primer crédito Kiva, por confiar en mi y ahora por darme una nueva oportunidad”
Su anterior crédito lo invirtió muy bien hizo el desagüe de agua  lluvia, rellenó el patio y le hizo su plantilla, instaló un lavadero de ropa y una canaleta y esto le ayudó a mejorar su vivienda por eso ella está muy satisfecha.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Patrona Márquez  puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/185306
texts.en:
Patrona Márquez is renewing her Kiva loan because now she needs to improve her kitchen much more so that she can offer excellent service to her tenants. She will extend a wall and plaster the rooms that have tenants. She sends the following message to her financiers from Kiva: "I am very grateful to the people who helped me with my first Kiva loan, for having confidence in me and now for giving me a new opportunity." She invested her last loan very well. She redirected the rainwater drainage, filled in the patio, installed flooring, and installed a wash stand for laundry and a drainage system. This helped her improve her home, and for this she is very satisfied.

If you want to know more about the story of Patrona Márquez, you can go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/185306.

loans.use: Improve her property

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase used clothing, new clothing, fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar sacos de abono y fertilizantes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: retail business expansion

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza, madre soltera, trabaja para una ferretería, la seguridad de su familia es esencial por tal sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco ya que con el préstamo anterior instalo cerámica, en este ciclo de préstamo lo utilizara para la construcción de un porche por tal requiere compra materiales de construcción como: Cemento, hierro, arena, zinc entre otros materiales.
Agradece ala financiera por su apoyo para el desarrollo de un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza is a single mother who works for a hardware store.  With family safety foremost in her mind, she has plans to improve her home's infrastructure little by little.  With her previous loan she installed ceramic tiles.  She plans to use this cycle's loan to build a porch and, therefore, needs to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, sand and zinc, among other materials.

She is grateful for the financial support which allows her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: Un grupo solido y emprendedor con un solo objetivo en común el D. generar estabilidad económica para sus familias y negocios propios, a si se caracterizan el grupo Santa María, conformado por  10 integrantes con grandes  deseos D. superación, formado hace mas D. 2 años, este grupo se empeña por dar lo mejor D. sí mismo en cada paso  que dan hacia adelante, muestra D. ello es la señora Jacinta B. D. 47 años D. edad divorciada y con 2 hijos D. los cuales uno aun es menor D. edad. Jacinta  se dedica diariamente a la atención D. su bodega que es una forma D. ingreso muy estable ya que también por las tardes se dedica a la venta D. anticuchos (una comida típica D. la región), ambos ingresos económicos le generan ganancias estables para poder salir adelante y poder pagar los estudios D. sus hijos. En el futuro le gustaría poder ampliar su bodega para a si poder generar más ventas. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compra D. mercadería como arroz y azúcar para la venta, también una parte del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra D. útiles escolares para su último hijo.
texts.en:
A solid, enterprising group with one goal in common: to generate economic stability for their families and businesses.  This is how the Santa María group, maD. up of ten members with a great drive for self improvement, can be characterized.  Formed over two years ago, the group strives to give the best of themselves at each step they take forward.  

An example of this is Mrs. Jacinta B., 47.  Divorced with two children, one of whom is still a minor, Jacinta tends daily to her store which is a very stable source of income while also in the afternoons selling anticuchos (a typical regional dish consisting of skewered, roasted meats).  Both sources of income produce stable profits to get ahead and pay for her children’s education.

In the future she’d like to expand the store to generate more sales.  She will use the recent loan to buy merchandise, like rice and sugar, to sell.  Part of the loan will be used to buy school supplies for her youngest son.

loans.use: For merchandise, like rice and sugar, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Rosa Josefina

texts.es:
Rosa casada, su esposo trabaja como bombero de gasolinera,  y le ayuda con los gasto de la casa, sus planes es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda, pero por falta de financiamiento no lo ha logrado.
Trabaja como maestra de una escuela desde unos años atrás, trabajadora y responsable, solicitad un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedra, bloques, piedras canteras, alambre, láminas de zinc, perlines y estribus para la construcción de un cuarto obteniendo comodidad, seguridad y protección para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and her husband works as a gas station attendant.  She helps him with the household expenses and wants to improve her home's infrastructure but has been unable to obtain financing.

She has worked as a school teacher for several years and is very hard-working and responsible.  She plans to use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, bricks, wire, zinc sheeting, and metal profiles to add on a room for the comfort, safety and protection of her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es:
Luz Helena con su anterior crédito compró insumos como tintes, tratamientos, capilares y extensiones de cabello con los que puso elegante a sus clientes y mejoró su imagen.  Ahora necesita comprar mas insumos,  porque el aumento del número de clientes ha sido muy bueno y  se ha quedado sin insumos, así sus clientes llevan los productos y muchas veces les queda difícil conseguirlos con la calidad que Luz Helena requiere para embellecerlos, por eso está solicitando un nuevo credikiva, con el cual seguirá promoviendo la belleza, como parte del arreglo personal diario de cada persona. Ella da las “gracias a sus fondeadores por su colaboración pues  fue de gran ayuda”.  Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Luz Helena ingrese al siguiente enlace:
  
http://kiva.org/lend/204887
texts.en:
Luz Elena used her prior loan to buy supplies like hair coloring, hair and scalp treatments and hair extensions with which she made her customers elegant and improved their image.

She needs to buy more supplies now because the increase in customers has been very good and she has run out of supplies.  Sometimes her customers bring their own supplies but often it’s difficult for them to get them of the quality that Luz Elena needs to make them beautiful so she is asking for a new Kiva loan to continue promoting beauty as part of a person’s daily personal routine.  She “thanks her funders for their collaboration because it was a big help.” 

If you’d like to know Luz Helena's history, please click on the following link:

http://kiva.org/lend/204887

loans.use: to buy supplies like hair coloring, hair and scalp treatments and hair extensions.

loans.name: Flor De Fatima

texts.es: Flor casada su esposo trabaja para una empresa privada, sus hijos con estudios universitarios siendo unas de sus misiones. Proyecto de construir su casa por completo en un proceso poco a poco y gracias al financiamiento de Afodenic, con el préstamo anterior hizo el porche de la casa, ahora comprara materiales como: cemento, arena, piedra, bloques, piedras canteras, alambre, láminas de zinc, perlines y estribus para la construcción un cuarto. Obteniendo la comodidad y seguridad de su familia.
texts.en: Flor is married. Her husband works for a private business. Her children being in college is one of her missions. Complete construction of her house is a project she has been doing little by little. Thanks to the previous loan from Afodenic, she made the house' porch. Now she will but materials such as: cement, sand, blocks, quarry stones, wire, zinc sheeting, iron bars and supports to build a room. Thus she will obtain comfort and safety for her family.

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
Deysi  es madre soltera  tiene 1 hijo pequeño  su trabajo es primordial para ella por que siendo sola, tiene que mantener a su hijo y correr con todos los gastos que ello implica  a pesar de tener  19 años a adquirido muchas responsabilidades como estar  cargo de sus hermanos esto debido a la separación de sus padres, su papa que es confeccionista le dejo el taller  para que ella lo trabaje  ahí confecciona toda clase de prendas femeninas también hace estampados de polos, toda la mercadería que producen la envía a Chiclayo donde su papa las comercializa, en estos meses las ventas son buenas por ser época escolar aumentan los pedidos de uniformes y buzos justamente para eso utilizara su préstamo, para comprar telas  para la confeccion de  buzos. Ella es parte del grupo “TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA” donde tiene el cargo de secretaria, con el negocio que maneja quiere lograr muchos proyectos primero quiere terminar sus estudios de diseño y estampado para  poner en practica todo lo aprendido y lograr que su negocio llegue a ser una empresa grande.

*Deysi es la primera de la foto esta con un cuaderno color naranja,la Sra. que aparece cargando su hijito es una invitada.
texts.en:
Deysi is a single mother of a small child.   Her work is paramount to her because, being alone, she has to support her child and cover all expenses.  This means that, despite being just 19 years old, she has acquired many responsibilities like having to care for her siblings due to her parents’ separation.  Her father is a clothes maker and left her the workshop so that she can work it making all kinds of women’s clothes.  She also does silk screening on polo shirts.  All the merchandise she produces is sent to Chiclayo where her father sells it.  During these months sales are good because the school year is starting and orders for uniforms and sweat shirts increase which is precisely what she will use the loan for: to boy fabric to manufacture sweatshirts.  She is a member of the “TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA” (Working in Harmony) group where she has the position of Secretary.  

She wants to accomplish lots of projects with the business she runs but first she wants to finish her Design and Silk Screening courses to put into practice what she’s learned thus making her business into a large firm.

*Deysi is the first one in the photo; she’s carrying an orange notebook.  The woman carrying a baby is a guest.

loans.use: To buy fabric to manufacture sweatshirts.

loans.name: Jose Donald

texts.es: El señor José, habita en el municipio de La concepción, junto a su esposo la cual labora como operaria en zona franca, para poyarlo con  los gastos del hogar ya que tienen tres hijos que están a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es  mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyarlos siempre en sus estudios. Don José desde hace veinte años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y la principal afectación han sido las plagas y enfermedades dentro del cultivo ya que carecen de fertilizantes, plaguicidas entre otros, lo cual necesita un financiamiento para poder realizarle al cultivo un mejor cuido ya que siendo así este dará un mejor resultado dando frutas grandes, jugosas y de un buen tamaño.
texts.en: José lives in the town of La Concepción with his wife, who works in the free trade zone to help with the household expenses. They are raising three children. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and always support their schooling.  For twenty years, José  has worked in agriculture. The main problem has been pests and illneses in the crops, since they lack pesticides and fertilizer, among other things. He needs a loan to be able to care for his crops better since in this way he will have bigger and more juicier products.

loans.use: To buy materials and fertilizers

loans.name: Reynaldo Andres

texts.es:
Reynaldo casado su esposa se dedica al destacé de cerdo y sub producto del mismo, le apoya con los gastos con la ganancia por la  venta de su producto. 
Es un cliente que se dedica en un 100% a la actividad agrícola desde muy joven, tiene considerado mejorar la vivienda con los ingresos de la producción, su mayor dificulta nos explica que ha sido la afectación de plagas en sus cultivos y daños por robos.
El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes con el objetivo de brindarle el mantenimiento agronómico al cultivo de piña y el platanero. Abonando la plantaciones y obtener una buena producción para venderla a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is married.  His wife devotes herself to butchering pigs and their by-products.  With the income from selling her product, she helps him with the expenses. 

Since he was very young Reynaldo has devoted himself 100% to farming.  He is planning to improve his house with the income from production.  His greatest difficulties, he tells us, have been the effect that the pests have on the crops and the loss from robberies.

He will use the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers.  His objective is to provide maintenance for his pineapple and banana crops.  He will fertilize the crops and get a good production in order to sell them at a better price.

loans.use: Buy supplies for harvesting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expand her tortilla stall and animal-raising business

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
Estefana G. V.:es de 55 años de edad,vive con su hija junto con su nieta,ella nos cuenta que tiene mucha experiencia en ventas, ya que desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su madre a vender,ella nos cuenta que inicio haciendo costuras y vendiendo comida de casa en casa despues puso una tortilleria con la cual pudo construir su casa, actual mente tiene una tienda donde vende productos comestibles de primera nacesidad,como frijol,arroz,maiz,azucar,etc su sueño es poder tener otra tienda para aumentar su capital y asi estar bien economicamente y asi poder ayudar a su hija y su nieta solicita este credito para compra de productos comestibles como,  frijol,arroz,maiz,azucar,
etc. ella espera que Fape le pueda ayudar con su credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Estefana G. V., age 55, lives with her daughter and her granddaughter.  She tells us that she has a lot of experience in sales.  When she was very young she helped her mother sell.  She tells us that she started sewing and selling food door to door.  After that she established a tortilla business, which allowed her to build her house.  

She currently has a store where she sells basic needs food products like beans, rice, corn, and sugar, etc.  Her dream is to be able to have another store in order to increase her capital.   That way she would be alright financially, and she would be able to help her daughter and her granddaughter.

She will use the loan to buy food products like beans, rice, corn, and sugar, etc.  She hopes that Fape is able to help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: To buy food products like beans, rice, corn, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 100 bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Foamy and other supplies to make notebooks and agendas and to decorate area  preschool and kindergarten classrooms.

loans.name: Abdilia

texts.es:
La señora Abdilia, habita en el municipio  de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo que labora como comerciante, ellos tienen cinco hijos tres mayores de edad e independiente, el de 18 y 16 años, estudian su secundaria y le apoyan con las actividades de hogar.
Desde hace diez años se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas por temporada de cada frutas o verduras, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es no optar con un capital suficiente para hacer efectivo cada compra para poder trabajar y sacar hacia adelante a su dos hijos que necesitan tanto el apoyo de su mamá como el del papá. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos para vender como: frutas, verduras, granos básicos, leña entre otros.
texts.en:
Abdilia lives with her husband, who works as a merchant, in the Ticuantepe municipality.  She and her husband have five children.  The three oldest are independent, and the 18 year old and 16 year old go to high school.  They help her with the household chores.

She has been buying and selling seasonal crops of fruits or vegetables for ten years.  The greatest difficulty that presents itself is not having enough money to pay for each purchase.  She needs the purchases to be able to work and get her two children ahead.  They really need support from their mother as much as from their father.

She will use the loan to buy products to sell.  She will buy products like fruit, vegetables, and basic grains, among others.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: German Gustavo

texts.es:
Germán Garzón Rodríguez con su anterior credikiva compró materiales de madera y lienzos y logró aumentar ligeramente su capital. En la actualidad está preparándose para aplicar a su segundo  credikiva,  con el cual comprará aguarrás, pergaminos en cuero, oleos, lienzos, cera de abejas, para fabricar lámparas, percheros y pinturas, con estos productos diversificará su oferta,  porque viene con nuevos  modelos al mercado y él sabe que va a impactar, porque tiene en sus productos implícita  toda su creatividad e inspiración, al servicio de los clientes y admiradores del buen arte.
“Gracias por dar a conocer mi trabajo artístico” es el mensaje que Germán envía a su financiadores de Kiva .
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de German puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
texts.en:
Germán Garzón Rodríguez bought wood materials and canvasses with his previous Kiva loan and was able to slightly increase his capital. At present, he is preparing himself to apply for his second Kiva loan. With it, he will buy turpentine, leather parchment, oil paints, canvasses, and beeswax to make lamps, coatracks and paintings. With these products he will diversify what he offers, because he brings new models to the market and he knows what will make an impact. He has all of his creativity and inspiration implicit in his products and serves his customers and admirers of good art.      

“Thanks for letting my artistic work be known" is the message that German sends to his Kiva lenders. 

If you want to know German's story, you can go to the following link:

loans.use: He will buy turpentine,  leather parchments, oil paints, canvasses, and beeswax to make lamps, coatracks and paintings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure and bird guano.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expanding Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pea seeds, bags of fertilizer, and insecticides for insect pests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pea seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
El señor Simón C. tiene 65 años estado civil viudo, él cría un nieto viven en la población de Colomi que está ubicado a 42 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, El sr. Simón C. tiene una tienda de abarrotes nos comenta que necesitaba más capital para ampliar la tienda porque  tiene muchos clientes. Simón es una persona humilde trabajadora y responsable, para él es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos de la ciudad que les piden muchos requisitos. 

Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito, El sr. Simón C. está muy contento de haber conseguido un crédito y poder ampliar la tienda de abarrotes ahora tendrá más ingreso por la venta de ( aceite, fideo, macarrón, azúcar etc.) podrá ahorrar dinero para ayudar a su nieta en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Simón C. is 65-years-old and a widow.  He takes care of a grandchild and lives in the town of Colomi that is located 42 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  He has a grocery store and he told us that he needs more capital to expand the store because he has many customers.  Simón is a very humble, hard-working, and responsible person.  It is very difficult for him to use the city banks as they request that he fulfill many requirements.

He had the initiative to go to come here to sign up for a loan.  He is very happy to obtain a loan and to be able to expand his grocery store.  Now he will have more income from selling oil, noodles, pasta, sugar, et cetera and can save money to help his granddaughter in her studies.

loans.use: Working capital for a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Josselyn

texts.es: La Srta. Josselyn es soltera, tiene 20 años de edad,  Josselyn estudia Diseño de Modas en un instituto de prestigio que le ha permitido trabajar como diseñadora de modas en una empresa donde realiza las funciones de diseñar en computadoras y también cose y crea modernos diseños de ropa, ella eligió esta profesión porque  es su vocación y también le generara mejores ingresos económicos, el sueño de Josselyn es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por ella pero lo mas importante ser una gran profesional, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que Josselyn  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Ms. Josselyn is single and 20-years-old. She is studying fashion design at a prestigious institute that has allowed her to work as a fashion designer at a  company that designs on computers and also sews and creates modern clothing designs. She chose this profession because it is her vocation and also because it generates good income. Josselyn's dream is to give her parents a higher quality of life and somehow give back to them for all that they have done for her. What is most important is for her to be a great professional with the goal of continuing to grow. The loan will be used to pay tuition and for professional experience. Edaprospo (Kiva field group) knows that Josselyn will meet her goals with hard work and effort and that their loans will help her.

loans.use: tuition and professional experience

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Expand typical clothing sales stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and gladiolus bulbs as well as fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a glass case and fill it with shoes, women’s accessories, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Claricsa Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Claricsa del Socorro López , tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , comunidad el edén , ella es madre soltera , habita con sus tres hijos los cuales estudian y le apoyan con las actividades del hogar y el mayor de ellos de 16 años después de clases le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas , doña Claricsa tiene el sueño de ver sus hijos en la universidad ya que ella a luchado mucho atrávez de su humildad y sencilla  ya que viene de una familia de campesinos que lo que ella aprendió fue trabajar la tierra , desde hace 20 años , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que su cultivo carece de fungicidas , fertilizantes y otros derivados agrícolas lo cual puede perderlo , ella necesita que se le apoye para la hacer efectiva la compra de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para poder vender a un mejor precio y obtener mejor beneficio tanto para el cultivo como para su familia .
texts.en:
42-year old Señora Claricsa del Socorro López lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe in the community of Edén. She is a single mother of three children who attend school and help around the house. The eldest is 16 years old and also helps in the fields.

Doña Claricsa’s dream is to see her children go to university. She has struggled to overcome her modest roots as she comes from a family of country folk from whom she learned over the last twenty years how to work the earth. 

Her biggest problem is a lack of fungicides, fertilizer, and other agricultural products for her fields. She needs assistance to buy these items so that she can sell her crops for a good price. Her fields will benefit from the purchase, and so will her family.

loans.use: purchase of fungicides, fertilizer, and other agricultural products

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana de 60 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde muy joven la mama le enseño a confeccionar ropa. Y desde ese tiempo ha trabajado con esfuerzo y dedicación para ser una microempresaria. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm. Hace camisas, blusas, pantalones en el taller de costua que lo tiene ubicado en su casa. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar haciendo ropa y concesionándola. 

Con el préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar su vivienda y asi tener más espacio para su taller de costura ya que lo tiene ubicado en su casa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a 60 year-old hard-working woman who learned sewing from her mother at a very early age.  Since then she has worked with effort and dedication to become a micro-businesswoman.

Her work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She makes shirts, blouses, trousers, etc.  She has many aspirations with her business and wants to continue making clothing and supplying on a concession basis.  She plans to use the loan to buy construction materials to renovate her home and have more space for her activity, since her shop is located in her home.  In the future she would like to finish building her home.

loans.use: Cemento, bloques

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El señor Juan José Cuaresma. Habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, en la comunidad Pablo Calero, junto a su esposa que es ama de casa, ellos tiene seis hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, don Juan tiene el sueño de poder dejarle algo a su hijos los cual siempre han sido un familia muy unida a pesar de todos su situación económicas ya que son personas de campo muy humildes, el seño Juan desde hace 31 años se decía a trabajar las tierras que adquirió atrávez de la reforma agraria ya que con sus platillos de piña  y hortaliza pudo mantener a su hijos e esposa , ahora don Juan presenta una situación que para él es muy difícil ya que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para poder comprar fertilizantes e insumos  para su cultivo de piña , lo cual solicita que se le apoye para poder realizar la comprar y sacar un mejor producto y venderlo en un mejor precio .
texts.en:
Señor Juan José Cuaresma lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe in the community of Pablo Calero with his wife who looks after the household. They have seven children, all of them adults who have left home.

Juan’s dream is to be able to leave something for his children to inherit. The family has always been very close-knit despite their poor economic situation. They are simple country folk.

For the last 31 years Juan has worked on the land he acquired through agrarian reform. He supports his family with the pineapple and vegetables that he produces. Currently he faces a difficult situation as he doesn’t have enough money to buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies for the pineapples. He is seeking a loan to buy these products so he can grow better produce and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pea seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pea and potato seeds, as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Alba, de 57años, es originaria del  departamento de Estelí,  es madre soltera ,tiene una hija .
De oficio comerciante y sastre al mismo tiempo,  tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual atiende ella misma y  lleva 13 años en su negocio. Comenzó a trabajar a los 20 años como costurera, aprendió sastrería con un curso que le financio su padre. En el año 1993 inicio con su negocio de pulpería, con los ingresos obtenidos de la costura, primero compro una cajita de jabón, dulces y pan.
En el año 1998 comenzó a trabajar con  su primer préstamo, que fue de  C$ 10,000 córdobas neto y lo uso para comprar vitrinas, exhibidores y productos para la venta.  La mayoría de sus clientes son los trabajadores de una fábrica de tabacos, la cual queda en frente  de su negocio. Siempre se ha dedicado a la sastrería sin dejar de lado la pulpería. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar 2 pacas de ropa, comprar, aceite, arroz, azúcar y otros productos al por mayor para conseguirlos  buen precio. 
Este crédito le ayudara a incrementar su negocio y mejorar las ventas, ya que tiene bastante solicitud de sus productos.
Tiene como plan ampliar mas su pulpería ,surtirla con mas variedad de producto  y meta próxima comprar u exhibidor de bebidas de gaseosas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba is 57 years old and from the department of Estelí.  She is single and has a daughter.

She is both a seamstress and a merchant with a small grocery store that she has been running herself for 13 years.  She began to work at age 20 as a seamstress after learning the trade through a course her father paid for.  In 1993 she began her grocery business with the income she obtained through her sewing.  Her first purchases were a box of soap, sweets and bread.

In 1998 she began working with her first loan (C$ 10,000) which she used to buy display cases, counters and products.  Most of her customers are workers at the tobacco factory across the street from her store.  She has always kept up with her seamstress business while never interrupting her grocery activity.

She plans to use the loan to buy two packages of clothing as well as oil, rice, sugar and other products.  She plans to buy them wholesale to get better prices.  This loan will help her increase sales since she has many requests for products.

Her plan is to expand her grocery and stock it with a variety of products.  One of her goals is to buy a softdrink display case.

loans.use: To buy two packages of clothing, oil, rice, sugar and other products

loans.name: Norma Carlota

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora  Norma, tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y tuvo 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, ella es nacida en Montecristi pero debido a la salud de su esposo tuvieron que irse a vivir a San Jacinto ya hace algunos años.
 
Se dedica junto a su esposo a la perfección y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, trabajan todos los días ya que el proceso del sombrero es un poco complicado, el cual lo realizan con mucho amor porque les gusta lo que ellos hacen además porque saben que su trabajo es muy apreciado en muchos lugares hasta donde ellos envían sus productos y porque les deja buenas ganancias. Los sombreros en forma cruda o semi elaborado lo compran en Montecristi, los terminan y los venden a turistas que llegan hasta el local y también entregan a comerciantes que los envían a otros lugares.

Este crédito es para comprar más sombreros. Este es su tercer crédito en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiar su negocio y además  las reuniones ya que en ellas aprende mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Norma, aged 65, married and the mother of six children, all grown up. She was born in Montecristo, but due to her husband's health they had to leave for San Jacinto a few years ago.

Together with her husband she completes and sells straw hats. They work every day, since producing a straw hat is rather complex. They love what they do because they know that their work is much appreciated by their clients and because they earn a good income. They buy basic or semi-finished hats in Montecristo, complete them and sell them to tourists who come to their store. They also wholesale hats to merchants who ship them to their own customers elsewhere.

This loan will be used to buy more hats. It is her third loan with the Communal Bank. She is grateful because the loans help her to finance her activity and she learns a lot during the meetings. Her dream is to stay in good health, she and her husband.

loans.use: To buy straw hats

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Zoa Filomena

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

En este hermoso lugar conocimos a la señora Zoa, tiene 39 años de edad y es madre soltera de dos hijos de 13 y 10 años, el mayor esta en colegio y la menor en el último año de escuela. Ella  está viviendo en la casa de la mamá.
 
Es una gran madre que por sus hijos lucha día a día, tiene un pequeño restaurant donde vende una buena variedad de platos, en las mañanas vende encebolladlos y en las tardes y noches platos de acuerdo al día pero de especialidad mariscos y  platos a  la carta  de acuerdo a lo que pidan sus clientes, lleva ya tres años con su negocio y le ha ido bien a pesar de todo. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 17h00.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pescado, arroz, plátano y otros productos e ingredientes  para la preparación de los alimentos ya que viene la temporada de carnaval y muchos turistas llegan hasta la ciudad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y está muy contenta porque los créditos le han sacado de muchos apuros. Sus sueños son tener su casa y algún día un local propio ya que en el que esta es arrendado.
texts.en: Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike. It is in this lovely place that we met Señora Zoa. She is 39 years old, single and the mother of two children. Her elder son is 13 and attends secondary school; her daughter is 10 and in the final year of elementary school. She lives in her mother's house. She is a great mum who struggles every day for the sake of her children. She runs a small restaurant with a large variety of dishes. In the morning she prepares encebollado, a popular soup made of tuna fish, cassava, tomatoes and onions and generally sprinkled with lemon juice. In the afternoon and evening she sells the dish of the day consisting of seafood and any meal served à la carte. Zoa has been in this business for already three years and has done well despite some challenges. She works every day from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. This loan will be used to buy fish, rice, bananas and other products and ingredients for food preparation, ahead of the carnival season when many tourists come to town. She has had four loan cycles from the Communal Bank and is very happy because the loans have eliminated many a difficult situation. Her dream is to have her own house and someday her own business premises because currently she works in a rented place.

loans.use: To buy fish, rice, bananas, seafood and other ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Indaura Margarita

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Indaura, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada hace ya 35 años  y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven en el exterior y dos en otras ciudades del país, con ella viven dos nietas de 11 y 10 años que son como sus hijas y que estudian en escuela. Su esposo es pescador.

Ella trabaja en un colegio de San Jacinto como guardián, pero además se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de las marcas Nature Garden en la cual ya lleva 13 años y de Obnilife en la cual lleva dos años, trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades y en lo que es venta en las tardes después que los alumnos se hayan ido del plantel educativo aunque también vende a los maestros de este centro que son sus clientes, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son el Aloe beta, Fiver Plus, One Miel, entre otros.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos naturales. Está en el Banco Comunal hace ya tres años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan a ella y  a sus amigas socias. Sus sueños son comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Indaura, aged 55 and married for 35 years. From this union she has five children, all grown up. Three of them live abroad and two live in other cities of the country. Two granddaughters, 11 and 10 years old, live with her and attend school. To Indaura they are like daughters. Her husband is a fisherman.

She works as a security guard at a school in San Jacinto, but she also sells natural products of the brands Nature's Garden (for 13 years) and Obnilife (for 2 years). She works every day in her various activities. In the afternoon she sells her products after the students have left the school site. She also sells to the teachers of her school. She sells on credit and collects payment every fortnight. She does her best business with the products Aloe Beta, Fiber Plus and One Miel, among others.

This loan will be used to buy more natural products. She has been with the Communal Bank for already three years. She is grateful for the help provided to her and the other members. Her dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy natural products of the brands Nature's Garden and Obnilife

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale during the school term

loans.name: Ángela Piedad

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, ella tiene 45 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 25, 24 y 16 años los mismos que aun viven en su casa, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
 
Tiene un pequeño comedor en el mercado de San Jacinto, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja sola de lunes a sabados desde las 05h00 hasta las  a las dos de la tarde. Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por años y que siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos, su especialidad son los mariscos ya que es un plato muy apetecido por los turistas que acuden  a este hermoso lugar.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos y así estar preparada para la temporada de carnaval que espera que sea muy buena. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cuatro ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le permite financiarse cuando ella lo necesita. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y algún dia comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Ángela. She is 45 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children, aged 25, 24 and 16. They still live at home, and the youngest attends secondary school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She has a small restaurant at the market in San Jacinto, where she serves delicious dishes. She works alone from Monday to Saturday from 5 a.m. to 2 p.m. She has had her restaurant for several years and has done very well, because her customers like the taste of her dishes. Her specialty is seafood and is in high demand from tourists who come to this beautiful place.

This loan will be used to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for food preparation, ahead of the carnival season which will hopefully be very profitable. She has had four loan cycles from the Communal Bank and is very happy because the loans allow her to finance her activity when she needs it. Her goal is to progress in her business and someday buy a car.

loans.use: To buy rice, fish, meat, seafood and other ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Jenny Amparo

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, ella tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en Universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una despensa de viveras de consumo, vende productos  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otros. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 23h00, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo y algunos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que por esta época son muy buenas las ventas por la época de carnaval ya que muchos turistas llegan a vacacionar por toda la temporada playera.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son tener un negocio más grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Jenny, 44 years old and married. From this union she has two sons. The elder son is 17 and studies at the university, and the younger is 16 and is in secondary school. Her husband is a farmer.

She has a grocery store and sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and detergents, among others. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. and her sons and her husband help her. She buys her inventory in downtown Portoviejo and sometimes goods are delivered to her store. She told us that currently she has a good turnover at the carnival season, because at this time many tourists spend their vacation at the beach.

This loan will be used to stock up her grocery. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples. She has had four loan cycles from the Communal Bank and likes it because she made friends with other group members. Her goal is to have a larger store and that her children become professional workers.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad T. is from the village of Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Natividad owns a business comes providing general services to local community members. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Natividad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Natividad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Jereza

texts.en:
Jereza is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.  Jereza is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase raw materials. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jereza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea R. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 38 years old. Andrea is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Andrea owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Andrea has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Andrea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andrea is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Andrea from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao S. is a 50-year-old widow and local villager living in Phnom Penh City. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow vegetable crops for both dry and rainy seasons and she always gets good results because she has had experience in this sector since 2000. Sao S. typically generates an income of around $3 US to support the family.

Sao S. has two children; one is married and the other is single and works as a seamstress. Sao S.’s daughter doesn’t have her own vehicle to ride to her job location; instead, she hires a motor taxi. To reduce the cost of traveling expenses, Sao S. is applying for a loan for her daughter to purchase a secondhand motorcycle. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to invest in planting vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita A. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Emerita is married and has three grown children. To make a living, Emerita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish, milkfish, and sardines  in the local community. Emerita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Emerita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. 

Emerita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products, like milkfish and mackerel, to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Emerita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products, like milkfish and mackerel, to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita E. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years-old. Juanita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as junk food, snacks such as rice cakes, and a variety of beverages including softdrinks and fruit juices in the local community. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juanita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as junk foods and beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina P. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and beverages in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Gina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Gina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products, such as canned goods and beverages, to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Gina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach M., 54, makes and sells rattan cupboards and beds. She is the mother of two single children, who assist her in making furniture. Lach M. has no life partner as her husband died of illness years ago.

Since 2009, Lach M. and her sons have also ordered rattan items in bulk from braiders, which they then sell at retail prices door-to-door across the province. Lach M. runs her business very well because she sells her items at reasonable prices. In order to better satisfy her customers' needs, Lach M. seeks a loan to stock a larger amount of beds to sell.

loans.use: to stock a larger amount of beds to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a 59-year-old widow who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   pig fattening, livestock and basket weaving. She lives in Danao City, Cebu. Gregoria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gregoria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future renovation of house. Gregoria is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari store and an electronic re-loading business. Her husband Armando, who is 47 years old, works as a machine operator to earn his living. They have three children who are between 15 and 24 years old. Ronalyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ronalyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second  loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for future house repair. Ronalyn is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

In order to earn additional income, Hin R. has requested a loan for her husband to buy a used motorbike in order to begin a new business as a motor taxi driver. This loan will help her family achieve a good standard of living. This couple is pictured in the photograph.

loans.name: Kyandago Development Group A, Kihihi

texts.en: N. Loy of Kyandago Development Group A is a 37-year-old determined, hardworking, and happily married mother of 5 children. She is a multi-business lady with a business of selling timber and wood from Bwindi, as well as being involved in agriculture and more specifically poultry. With the timber business, she has worked with her husband for 6 years, and she is grateful that the business has been moving smoothly because of the good market, especially from carpenters. She is able to make 280,000/= as monthly profits. Loy needs a loan to be able to buy more trees for her timber business.

loans.name: Komeza Group

texts.fr:
Nicodeme N. est un commerçant âgé de 29 ans qui habite  la commune urbaine de Cibitoke en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des articles de boutique  depuis 3 ans. Ila fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau des humanites completes. Il est celibataire. Il   arrive au 3e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant beaucoup  d’articles pour sa boutique et les  revendre a ses clients dans l’espoir de réaliser de grandes épargnes et ainsi accroitre son business. Il espère  arriver au stade d’importer de grandes quantites en provenance des autres pays de la sous-région comme l’Ouganda et ailleurs.

Il est un des membres  du groupe  Communautaire« Komeza».
texts.en:
Nicodeme N. is a 29 year old shopkeeper who lives in the Cibitoke quarter of the Bujumbura municipality. He has been a shopkeeper for three years. He attended school and was fully educated in the Humanities. He is single and this loan will be his third with the Turame microcredit association.

He is seeking a Kiva loan to boost his capital and to purchase a number of items for his shop which he will sell on to his customers. His aim is to put some savings aside and to grow his business. He wishes to reach the stage where he can import goods in large quantities from other countries, such as Uganda and others. 

He is a member of the Komeza community association.

loans.use: boosting his capital by buying a large number of products for his shop

loans.name: Altyn

texts.en:
Altyn M. is 52 years old. She lives with her son in Jany, Alysh village. She graduated from Industrial College and worked as a cook at the local café.  She got married and lived happily in marriage. But unfortunately, tragedy broke the life of her family -- her beloved husband died in a car accident and Altyn became the only bread winner. As her wage was too low to cover the expenses of the household, she started her own business reselling socks, which she chose because of its all-season potential. With the initial capital of 5,000 KGS, she managed to raise her floating capital to 40,000 KGS, and today she earns about 9,000 KGS per month. With her earnings, Altyn was able to buy a small house and reconstruct it. 

Now Altyn has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her assortment of goods, which will allow her raise her income. In the future, she dreams of building a big house for her grandchildren. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en: Veng A., age 33, is married with one child who is studying at university. She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she is also a domestic rice trader who owns a rice hulling machine inside her home. She provides a rice milling service to her neighbors. Her husband is a medical doctor. She says that she wants to take her finished products to sell in the other province, but she lacks the money to buy product. To solve this situation, Veng A. is applying for a loan to buy rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill; she will then sell her finished rice to people for income. With the rest of the funds, she would purchase a used motorcycle to transport her rice for selling in the mobile place.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill, and then sell finished rice for income.

Erikana B. is the leader of Kyandago development group B. He is a business man with a retail shop in Kyandago that has been in operations for four years. He sells sugar, salt, drinks and other general merchandise to the local people and travelers, since he is stationed by the road side outside of his home. He is able to make 200,000/= as monthly profits. Erikana is also a farmer with tea plants and the sale of matooke to the general public and the tea factory in his area. 

He needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for his shop.

texts.en:
Thomas has operated his cereals store in Naivasha town for the last three years. He is 41 years old, married to Jennifer Sote and they have six children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 40,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy maize in bulk to resell later at a profit.

In the future, Thomas hopes to grow his business and also sell different types of cereals.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk to resell

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a 66-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a fishing business. She lives in Bais City, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and fishing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Felina is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Felina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

Keaya Grace K. is from Kokowada near Elmina, Cape Coast where she sells fabrics. Married to a farmer, she has 5 children. Her income helps pay for school fees and some household expenses. 
To grow her business, she intends to use the loan to purchase more fabrics to boost sales volumes. Extra profits from this will be reinvested into her business.

loans.name: Elvies

texts.en:
One of the community partners of CCT*, Elvies T., dreams big for both his business and family. Elvies has been able to graduate from college. At 36, he is married to Irene, with whom he has three children. Together they live in Tanza, Cavite. To reach those big dreams, one of the steps Elvies took is to become a community partner of CCT.

Elvies runs a mini grocery, a dream for many small variety store owners. He also sells ready-to-wear clothes and school supplies based on the needs of his community. He has been running this business for five years now and is still counting. He manages to run the mini grocery alone, and monthly he earns an average of Php12,000.

To help him continue operation of his business, he would like to request a Php45,000 loan. With this amount he plans to buy a jeepney of his own with which he can deliver goods or products from one place to another. This will be of great help to his business, both for the mini grocery and the RTW business. The remainder of the loan money will be used to purchase more grocery items to add to his store.

Elvies constantly prays for a second floor to add to their house, because he wants the home to become better than it is at present. Also, it is his desire for his business to become productive and enable him to prepare a good future for his family. Of course, it is easily said than done, but for a person like Elvies who has the passion and determination to reach for his big dreams, nothing is impossible.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

Robert is also involved in the sale of beans and goats, all from capital earned from his farming business as a result of determination and good focus. He needs a loan to be able to improve and modernize his farm.

texts.en:
H. Gulom is 28 years old. He is married and has three children. Gulom is a conscientious worker dedicated to raising animals, primarily cattle, which he buys and sells in the commercial city markets. This work is very agreeable to him, because raising animals is what he enjoys most. Gulom requires a certain amount of money to increase the number of cattle he keeps. His goal is to increase his production and thereby increase his household income in addition to being solvent in order to continue working at buying and selling animals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, Toshpulot has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Toshpulot comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them. loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.en:
Ikhtiyor is married and has 4 children. His passion has always been woodwork. He learned the skill when he was a young. Since then, he's been experimenting and learning new things. With the experience he has gained in the process, he was been able to start his own small business manufacturing doors and windows about 11 years ago. Ikhtiyor has an individual approach to each client. He always tries to please his customers, even when they have very sophisticated taste. Ikhtiyor doesn't have to face high competition. However, he always aims at high quality and wants to have all his clients pleased with the result of his work. 

Ikhtiyor is requesting a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase additional raw materials to be able to provide his customers with even better quality and trendy furniture pieces. Ikhtiyor always has had much demand for his products as there are constantly new offices and stores being built. 
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Mahmadkul

texts.en:
Y. Mahmadkul is 28 years old. He is married and has three children. From the time he was young, Mahmadkul was learning to work in the small business of cattle breeding. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifices, and seeing his family progressing more and more. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children. He would like to see his children become professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason, Mahmadkul is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Kalondu

texts.en:
Kalondu M. has been selling charcoal and firewood in Kangundo town.  She has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly profit of KES. 5,000. She is 81 years old, and is married to Titus.  

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for her first loan after being introduced to KADET LTD by group members who are already clients of KADET LTD. She intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood to sell to her customers.  

She intends to plough back the additional income into the business so that she can have enough stock to sell to customers. She hopes to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for sale

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Kristia

texts.en:
Kristia is a 28-year-old lady who runs a kiosk business. Kristia lives with her husband, Maxi, who is 34 years old and their three children: Prasetyo, who is 9 years old and in the 4th grade of Elementary School; Misel, who is 6 years old and in the 1st grade of Elementary School, and; Arthur, who is 2 years old.

Kristia and her family live in Kelapa Lima Village. Kristia spends her days taking care of her family and running her own kiosk business. It is situated about 200 meters from her house. She usually operates her business from at 10.00 am to 09.00 pm. Kristia really enjoys running this business which she has had for four years. She decided to initiate a kiosk business as the income generated by her husband is not enough to finance her family's needs and cover their children's educational needs. 

Kristia would like to improve her income by selling mobile phone recharges and add more stock at her kiosk. Kristia would like to sell the mobile phone recharges as she believes that it can support her in generating more income for her family since the potential market for the mobile phone recharges is large. Kristia is sure that they will be sold out quickly.  Hence, Kristia is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. She is optimistic the loan will bring benefits for her business and her family life.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone recharges and add more stock

loans.name: Zibula Atudde Buikwe Group B-Lugazi

texts.en:
Rogers K. is a happily married 34-year-old gentleman.  He has 5 children who are all in school. Rogers operates a general merchandise retail shop in Lugazi town. This shop has been in existence for the past decade.  He started it using some of the savings from his farming business. 

Weekly this business generates for him 150,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more general merchandise stock to resell. Rogers also operates a rental business.  He is affiliated with the Zibula Atudde Buikwe group B-Lugazi.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to resell
