loans.name: 12 Bac Hai - Hoang Phong - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thanh L. T. (12) is a 38-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 05.01.12 Bac Hai - H. Phong - H. Hoa.

Thanh is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thanh operates a family member's business venture in the services sector operating a service: help local people to make rice ready for cook (local people bring their rice to Ms. Thanh house and Ms. Thanh uses machine to make it clean and ready for cook).  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase equipment to improve the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Bich P. T. (11) is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Tho T. T. (3) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Thuy T. T. (20) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Giau L. T. (13) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Ket H. T. (19) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Nghia T. T. (30) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh L. T. (12) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05.01.12 Bac Hai - H. Phong - H. Hoa (05.01.12).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ say sát gạo cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2005, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua T.ết bị để cải T.ện công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

4.  Giau L. T. (13) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
A. Ikromjon is 30 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Ikromjon makes his living raising cattle. He's the kind of man who works hard to provide for his family. Every day, from very early in the morning he tends to his cattle, feeding them and milking the cows. 

Currently, Ikromjon needs to buy young cattle to continue his business and, in turn, maintain his humble household. With your help, this young and energetic man can achieve his goals.    
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.name: Sanat

texts.en:
Sanat owns a rapidly growing business, selling sweets in the small town of Gafurov in Tajikistan. She has been in this business for 15 years and has proven to be a very sharp business owner. Sanat was able to purchase a storage container which helps her keep her inventory fresh. Another way she has been able to save money is to buy inventory directly from the manufacturers rather than from middlemen suppliers. 

Sanat has requested a loan of 6000 Somoni to help her purchase additional merchandise. She loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. Sanat and her husband are grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for them, but also to help their children.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is married and has two children. He sells food products in the market. Abdurahmon knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality items. He has been in the food market trade for about 12 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. 

Abdurahmon is hoping to invest a loan of 6000 Somoni in additional merchandise, which will help him eventually increase his turnover capital. He has a vision for the expansion of his business and we believe this loan will be helpful to his entrepreneurial endeavors -- it will help Abdurahmon to persist, taking small steps at a time to achieve success, which we think will be absolutely inevitable.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
O. Muhammad is a 53-year-old farmer who lives with his three children and wife. He has two milk cows and sells dairy products to local and capital traders. He is also engaged in a farming business. Muhammad has six years of experience in raising cattle and growing potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers. His milk products are in very high demand in his village. Muhammad’s orders for these products are very high but the milk his cows give is not enough for traders so he has decided to apply for a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase an additional cow and fertilizer for his land. Muhammad is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his standard of living with this loan.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.name: 'progressive Women' Group

texts.en:
Getrude T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of three borrowers called 'Progressive Women'.  She is 34 years old, single, and has two children who are 15 months of age and 10 years old. She was only able to attend school through 3rd grade due to financial constraints.

She describes herself as a friendly and kind woman whose dreams are to improve her business and build a house.

For three years, she has been selling soft drinks in New Georgia Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more crates of soft drinks.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Ade is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soft drinks

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: 'juah Nyansuah' Group

texts.en:
Togba N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of two borrowers called 'Juah N.'. He is 56 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 32 to 6 years old. He is a Physician's Assistant. 

For 26 years, he has been operating a clinic at Caldwell Junction, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 20,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars business loan to buy more drugs and one hospital bed. 

He describes himself as patient man whose goals are to improve his business and open a block factory.

loans.name: Muhsinjon

texts.en:
Muhsinjon is married and has two little children. He runs a business selling clothing and headdresses. Muhsinjon boasts a nice selection of items he offers for sale. He has many loyal customers who trust him and always come back for good quality, durable clothes when they shop at the market. Muhsinjon has been in the trade for three years. He is requesting a loan of $1,300 USD to increase his assortment of merchandise for the coming spring season. He is a hardworker and a determined businessman with clear vision and sober thinking. We believe Muhsinjon’s business will benefit from the current loan and will continue to grow, bringing him a stable income in the future.

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Ahror

texts.en:
T. Ahror is a 46-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Ahror has been running a business raising and selling cattle. He has five years' experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Ahror has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning and feeding them. Now Ahror wants to expand his business and buy more cattle so he has applied for a loan of $3000 USD. Ahror thanks all lenders for their support.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, including the heyday of the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, as well as epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's history:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

texts.fr:
Claudine Nyirambarushimana  est commerçant de tak tak (street vendor) membre du groupe Duterimbere mu kigombe, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Elle est né au Rwanda, elle est marié, et elle a 26 ans.  elle a 1 enfant de 3 ans, et elle a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  elle a une expérience de remboursements des prêts, car le cycle actuel de prêt qu’elle sollicite maintenant et le deuxième.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour son commerce de tak tak (commerce ambulant), et sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bien accueillir les clients.  Elle voudrait devenir grossiste, avoir une bonne habitation, et scolarise ses enfants dans l’avenir.
N.B : Le groupe est composé de 4 femmes, mais 3 sont malade c’est pourquoi ne son disponible sur la photo, elles sont remplacées par leurs maris. Seule Concilie est présente.
texts.en: Claudine Nyirandorimana is a tak tak merchant (street vendor) and has been a member of the group "Duterimbere mu kigombe" and a client of the micro-finance institution ACB since 2010. Born in Rwanda, he is 26 years old and married, and he has a 3-year-old child. Claudine himself completed six years of primary schooling. He has experience with repaying loans, since the current loan cycle he is now requesting is the second one. He is going to use this loan for his tak tak business (itinerant sales). His strategy for business growth is to accommodate his customers well. For the future, he would like to become a wholesaler, to have a nice home, and to provide schooling for his children.

texts.en:
Lukaya is the manager of the Community bank named “Bonne Semence Plus”. It is composed of 19 members united in solidarity of receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Lukaya started her business in 2001 selling miscellaneous goods. Today, she operates a general boutique. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of four children aged 4 to 13 who go to school. She has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans nine times and fully repaid them. With the weekly profit of about $110, she intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by buying cans, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other store items to resell at profit. Currently, Lukaya is happy to be part of one of HOPE’s groups because her business has been reinforced through the loan she received. Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler. She sells in the northern area of Kinshasa.

texts.en:
Mamie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Moonlight'. She is 41 years old, married and has four children who range from 1 to 19 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Mamie was only able to attend school through 3rd grade due to poverty. 

Mamie has been selling pepper, soap, milk, tomatoes and other items in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for eight years. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more pepper, soap, milk, tomatoes, etc. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman. Her goal is to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, soap, milk, tomatoes and other items

loans.name: 'united Women Development' Group

texts.en:
Ruth K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United Women Development'.  She is 41 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages of 24 and 13 years old. Ruth was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of support.

Ruth has been selling soft drinks in the Coca Cola Factory Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for ten years. She plans to use her 9,000 LRD portion of this 45,000 LRD group loan to buy more drinks to resell. She describes herself a kind woman whose dreams are to improve her business and build a store.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Mushabe

texts.en: Mushabe H. is an individual client from Ibanda. She is 42 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. H. is involved in the "boda boda" transport system where she buys motorcycles and gives them out on loan for a profit. She is also involved in the sale of produce, especially bananas and mostly from her plantations, and this contributes to increasing her income. She is a goal oriented lady with the drive to succeed. She needs a loan to be able to top up and buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional beans, sugar, rice, tomatoes and other vegetables

loans.name: 'one Love One Heart' Group

texts.en:
Neomi G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'One Love One Heart'. She is 22 years old, single, and has a 2-year-old child. Neomi was only able to attend school through 12th grade.

Neomi has been selling used clothes in the Redlight Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for three years. She plans to use her 15,000 LRD portion of this 86,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. Neomi describes herself as a kind woman whose goal is to build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lue is inset at the lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: to buy more bags of used clothes

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Norah

texts.es: La señora Norah vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, actualmete está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Se dedica a la a venta de comida y a la comercialización de abarrotes (pan, fiedo, sodas, etc). El préstamo solicitado es para incrementar su capital de trabajo y adquirir insumos para su negocio
texts.en: Norah lives in the Tembladerani district of La Paz, is married and has four children. She works selling food and groceries (bread, noodles, sodas, etc.). The requested loan is to increase her working capital and acquire goods for her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Migombani Group

texts.en:
Maria N., who is in her late thirties, is married with three children. She has been selling food and has a chicken business as well. She has been in these businesses for three years and works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily. She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maria's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of her food and to start selling chicken. She has paid back her previous loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase the stock of her food business. Her dream is to expand her chicken business premises.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group Migombani, which has a total of 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Maria is wearing purple in front.

loans.use: To increase stock of food

loans.name: Wealth Archiever's Group-Mpigi

texts.en: K. Godfrey, 28 years old, has been in the fishing business for the past 4 years in Namirembe-Mpigi. He got involved in this business after he sensed a ready market for fish in Namirembe. Godfrey had just gotten out of school by then. Fish is a popular delicacy in Mpigi and other neighboring areas. His business generates him 100,000 UGX weekly. Godfrey also ekes out side profits from a farm produce sales business. He plans to use this loan to buy more fishing nets. Godfrey is affiliated with Wealth Archievers group-Mpigi.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To reinvest in her business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor Mauricio vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz,actualmente está casado y tiene un hijo. Mauricio trabaja como currier. el préstamo será utilizado para la compra de un monitor LCD.
texts.en: Mauricio lives with his parents in the community of Alto Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has one son. Mauricio works as a courier. The loan will be used to purchase an LCD computer monitor.

loans.use: To purchase an LCD computer monitor.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

texts.en:
James D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God's Grace'.  He is 26 years old, single, and a high school graduate. He cares for two siblings.

James D. has been selling used shoes on Water Street, Monrovia, Liberia, for four years. He plans to use his 8,000 LRD portion of this 42,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used shoes. He describes himself as a peace-loving man whose goal is to develop his business.

loans.name: Katia Ninoska

texts.es:
Esta joven es casada, madre de una niña de dos años de edad, ha salido adelante en su estudios de nivel superior, actualmente es licenciada en administracion de empresario, es dueña de su negocio de Productos Plasticos, donde recibe su ingreso de la venta de sus productos,  de esta forma ah salido adelante en su económia.  
Solicita su crédito con el apoyo de Kiva  para compra de productos plasticos de su pequeño negocio.   
Su mayor sueño es de tener un buen inventario y productos dibersificado, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes,
texts.en:
This young woman is married and the mother of one 2-year-old daughter.  She's succeeded in her higher education and now has a degree in business administration.  She has her own plastic products business which is her source of income and has allowed her to get ahead financially.

She is seeing a loan with Kiva's help to buy plastic products for her small business.  

Her greatest dream is to have a good stock of diverse products to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her plastic products business.

Lawrence G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Good Guys'.  He is 31 years old, married, and has two children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. He also cares for two siblings. Lawrence is a high school graduate. 

Lawrence has been operating a foreign exchange bureau on Mechlin Street, in Monrovia, Liberia for 7 years. He plans to use his 20,000 LRD portion of this 60,000 LRD group loan to add more money to his business. Lawrence describes himself as a peace-loving man whose goals are to expand his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: to add more money to his business

Patricia has been selling used clothes on Water Street, in Monrovia, Liberia, for 5 years. She plans to use her 8,000 LRD portion of this 40,000 LRD group loan to buy more used clothes to resell. Patricia describes herself as a jovial woman whose dream is to improve her business.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es una joven que tiene un hijo, es madre soltera, que vive en la Comunidad de Sipe Sipe a 25 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, cuenta con 3 cabezas de ganado lechero de los cuales producen quesillo y los comercializa en el pueblo de Sipe Sipe, donde tambien tiene un pequeño ambiente y vende comidas tipicas como charques, chicharones, de viernes a lunes.

EL hijo de HIlaria asiste a la escuela en el mismo pueblo de Sipe Sipe, su hijo despues de la escuela le ayuda en su puesto de venta hasta  las 5 de la terde y luego se van a su casa que esta a 20 minutos caminando del pueblo. 

Hilaria desea incrementar su negocio de comidas comprar una cocina mas grande y ollas mas grandes porque su clientela esta creciendo, esto porque la zona es muy concurrida por la gente, que por motivos religiosos acuden a ese pueblo.

Hilaria desea poder dar a su hijo las mejores condiciones, que nunca le falte nada para poder estudiar, y con el tiempo poder abrir un restaurant grande.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a young woman with one child, a single mother, who lives in the community of Sipe Sipe, 25 km from the city of Cochabamba. She has three head of dairy cattle, whose milk she uses to produce farmer's cheese. She sells her products in the village of Sipe Sipe, where she also has a small sales stand and sells typical foods, such as dried meat and fried pork, from Friday to Monday. 

Hilaria's son attends school in the village of Sipe Sipe, and after school, he helps her in her sales stand until 5 in the evening. After that, they go to their home, which is a 20-minute walk from the village.  

Hilaria would like to expand her food business, buying a larger stove and bigger pots, because her customer base is increasing. This is because the area receives a lot of visitors who arrive in the village for religious events. 

Hilaria would like to provide better living conditions for her son, so that he will not lack for anything in his studies, and with time, she would like to be able to open a large restaurant.

loans.use: Operating capital for her food business

loans.name: Suhey Maria

texts.es: Suhey Maria es una mujer de 34 años que vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 17 años; ella  tiene un negocio donde vende carnes frías, pero también comercializa con ropa y calzado femenino y masculino,  sus principales clientes son amas de casa,  jóvenes y en general empleados, vecinos del sector y  de sus alrededores; con su negocio han logrado apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar, que conforman con sus 3 hijos  estudiantes  y con los que sueña apoyarlos intensamente,  para que se proyecten como unos profesionales de bien y muy prósperos. Su vida como comerciante inició, cuando, por la necesidad de obtener otros ingresos para impactar positivamente su hogar, le pidió a su papa que le vendiera queso a crédito, para  iniciarse en el mercado y  fue así, como comenzó con 20 libras, que posteriormente fueron 30, porque  gradualmente se incrementaron sus ventas; luego se le ocurrió, con las utilidades obtenidas por la venta de este producto, invertirlas en mercancías, aprovechando que tenia muchos compradores de queso, que se constituyeron en su   primer mercado de productos, como ropa y calzado, porque esta  idea prosperó, ya que la acogida de esta clientela fue una base importante para el desempeño de su nueva actividad. En la actualidad tiene cincuenta clientes fijos y cada uno la refiere constantemente, pues tiene alegría en el vender y esto manifiesta un buen servicio a la comunidad de compradores. Suhey otorga a ellos  créditos con plazos a 3 meses, ella compra al por mayor y obtiene descuentos de un 30 a un 40%. Durante el año los meses en los cuales incrementa sus ventas son Mayo, Junio, Septiembre, Noviembre y Diciembre. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio vendiendo muchos más productos a toda una gran clientela que  la esperan,  Y esto es lo más probable que ocurra, porque Suhey es una mujer con un gran carisma, que le alcanza el tiempo para todo y especialmente para darle amor a sus hijos,  atenderlos y obtener buenos ingresos por su trabajo. En la actualidad aplica a su credikiva con el cual comprará carnes frisa, ropa femenina, calzado para damas y caballeros y augura una inversión exitosa por su potencial mercado a quienes piensa convertir en sus clientes, pues ha hecho su preventa y con esta inversión responderá a ellos.  Su credikiva es el segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización a la que está vinculada hace dos años y con la que manifiesta que desde que comenzó en ella “su vida dio un giro  de 360 grados, porque le ha ayudado a hacer historia crediticia y esto ha  iluminado su camino hacia el éxito”.
texts.en:
Suhey Maria is a 34-year old woman who lives with her common-law husband and their three children, aged 1 and 17 years old. She has a business selling deli meats, but she also sells clothing and shoes for both men and women. Her main clientele is made up of housewives, young people and employees and neighbors in the sector and the surrounding areas. Her business has helped her husband provide for the family. The family is made up of 3 children who are going to school and to whom she dreams of supporting them every day, to see them have a career and become successful.

Her life as a merchants started when she saw the need to obtain and additional source of income to positively impact the household. She asked her father to sell her cheese on credit, in order to start out in the market. And that's how she started. At the start she had 20 pounds of cheese but later she took on 30 pounds because the sales had increased. It occurred to her later on to invest the earnings from this business sin the purchase of merchandise. Given that she had such a large clientele buying cheese she managed to build her own store to sell products such as clothing and shoes. Her idea was a success and the clientele that she had was an important base to start a new business. Currently she has fifty regular clients and search one visits her constantly. She is happy to make her sales and this translated into a positive impact to the merchant community. 

Suhey sells on credit, taking payments every 3 months. She buys in wholesale and obtains discounts of 30% to 40%. During the year she sees an increase in sales in certain months: May, June, September, November, and December. Her dream is to expand her business selling many other products to a large and demanding client base. It is very likely for this to happen because Suhey is a very charismatic woman.  She still has enough time for everything but especially to provide loving care to her children, and to earn a good income from her work. Currently she will invest her Kiva loan in the purchase of deli meats, ladies clothing, and ladies and gentlemen’s shoes.  This investment will reach any potential clients and make them into regular clients. She 
Has set her goal and this investment will help her meet their demands. This Kiva loan is her second through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and she has been with the organization for two years. Since she started with this organization she comments that "her life did a 360 turn because they have helped her establish a credit history and this have helped her pave the way towards success".

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.use: Reinvesting in his business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, bananas, potatoes, mineral water and other drinks.

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKADI sont mariés, avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Tiébiziédougou un des villages de la commune de Kadiolo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beurre de karité en générale. 
CHATOU T. compte acheter avec son  prêt  500kg de noix de karité pour les transformer en beurre. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village et dans les villages environnants . Le beurre de karité est  ensuite vendu au  grand marché de Kadiolo ville et au marché de Lofigué à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre partie pour certaines dépenses familiales et l’épargne.
texts.en: The four members of the Benkadi group are married women who are, on average age, 37 years old with 4 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Tiébiziédougou, a village in the Kadiolo commune, third administrative region of Mali.  This is their first loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of satisfying  their customers’ needs. Generally, this group of women sell shea butter.  With her loan, CHATOU T. plans to buy 500 kg of shea nuts and turn them into butter.  She gets her supplies in her village and from those nearby.  She sells shea butter for cash at the Kadiolo Lofigué Grand Market and the Lofigué market to a clientele composed of men and women.  She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 32,500 CFA, part of which will be used to pay down principal and interest on the loan and the remainder for various family expenses and savings.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe BENKELEMA sont mariés  avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Tiébiziédougou un des villages de la commune de Kadiolo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beurre de karité..
AWA S. compte acheter avec son  prêt  250kg de noix de karité pour les transformer en beurre. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village et dans les villages environnants .Le beurre de karité est  ensuite vendu au  grand marché de Kadiolo ville et au marché de Lofigué à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.250 FCFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre partie pour les dépenses familiales. 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKELEMA solidarity group are married women who average 28 years of age and three children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in the village of  Tiébiziédougou, in Kadiolo (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

The members sell shea butter. This is their first time collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.  

Awa S. intends to use her loan to buy 250 kg of sheanuts to make butter. She gets her stocks in the village and surrounding areas. The shea butter is then sold at the grand market of Kadiolo and at the Lofigué market, for cash, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 15,250 FCFA, which will be to repay the loan and interest, and to cover family expenses. Her goal is to increase her revenue and better serve her customers.

loans.use: To buy sheanuts

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El cliente tiene 32 años vive en el municipio de Entre Ríos del trópico de Cochabamba, empezó a trabajar a muy temprana edad junto a su padre, como peón en la tierra de su padre. Fue aprendiendo poco a poco, el cultivo de piña.

Emilio se independizo a muy temprana edad, ya que su padre falleció, y tuvo que trabajar solo en lote agrícola se su padre, posteriormente se concubino, tuvo un hijo, pero fue abandonado, pero poco a poco siguió adelante junto a su hijo, no le quedaba de otro que seguir trabajando duro, para no hacer faltar a su hijo, pero hoy en día ya está superando su crisis.

El crédito que solicita es para ampliar la producción de piña, más específicamente para comprar platines de piña, Emilio necesita un impulso, para poder ampliar y mejorar  su producción, que ha sido su sueño de toda su vida, tener grandes cultivos de piña y ser el mejor productor de piña de la zona, ya que la piña tiene gran demanda hoy por hoy. Ahora con el crédito seguirá creciendo.
texts.en:
He is 32 years old and he lives in the municipality of Entre Rios in the region of Cochabamba. He started working at a very young age with his father, as a farm hand for his father's land. He came to learn how to cultivate pineapples. 

Emilio became independent at a very young age, after the passing of his father. He was forced to work along in his father's plantation. Later he married and had a son but he separated. Together with his son he was able to pull through. He didn't have any other choice but to keep working hard and to not have his son want for anything. Currently he is coming out of the time of crisis. 

The loan that he requests will be used to expand pineapple production, more specifically to purchase seedlings. Emilio needs this support in order to expand and improve production. His life-long dream has been to have a large pineapple plantation and to be one of the best pineapple producers in the region. Pineapple is in great demand. With the help of this loan his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: To invest in his agriculture business.

loans.name: Sonia Rocio

texts.es:
Sonia D.  de 38 años de edad  vive en el guasmo escogió esta actividad ya que ella tenía un capital guardado de su anterior trabajo y se dedica a la venta de productos confiteca, analecsa. 
 
Unas de sus obstáculos es la delincuencia ya que es comerciante por pedido. Está casada tiene 3 hijos 13, 11 ,11 y estudian en escuela fiscal y su esposo trabaja en lo mismo. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos de confiteca y anelecsa. Unas de sus metas es poder llegar con sus productos inalecsa a luagares que ella no puede llegar.
texts.en:
Sonia D. is 38 years old and she lives in Guasmo. She started this business with savings she had from a previous employment. She sells Confiteca and Analesca brand products. 

One of the obstacles she faces is unpaid orders. She is a merchant who sells by taking orders. She is married and she has 3 children, aged 13, 11 and 11 years old. They are in school and her husband works in the same business as her. With the loan she will purchase Confiteca and Analesca brand products. One of her goals is to take her products to locales where she cannot currently reach.

loans.use: To purchase sweets.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI sont mariés, ont une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles polygames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de beurre de karité à l’image de NAHAWA K.  qui compte acheter avec son  prêt,  250kg de noix de karité pour les transformer en beurre.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Kadiolo les jours de foire et dans les villages environnants .
Le beurre de karité est  ensuite vendu au  grand marché de Kadiolo et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.250 FC CFA dont une partie est utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre partie épargnée pour le trousseau de sa fille. 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The members of the group BENKADI are married and average 42 years of age and 5 children. They live in polygamous families in Noumousso, a district in Kadiolo City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are on their sixth collaboration with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans were all settled. This group of women does commerce in karité butter, as does Ms. Nahawa K., who intends to use her loan to buy 250 kg of karité nuts and process them into butter. The group members get their supplies at the main market in Kadiolo City on market days and from surrounding villages. The karité butter is then sold for cash to a customer base composed of women and men at the main market of Kadiolo and within the family. Nahawa envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,250 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to cover the loan interest, and the other part will be saved for her daughter’s hope chest. Her ambition is to increase her turnover, so as to satisfy her customers further.

loans.use: Buying karité nuts

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Hilario Rodríguez C. tiene 61 años de edad, casado con la señora Felipa Miranda Ledezma mas de 15 años radican en la comunidad de Primera Candelaria hacia el norte de Colomi hace 23 años atrás, tienen 6 hijos dependientes de diferentes edades que estudian en nivel primaria y secundaria. 
                                                                                                                                                            
El señor Hilario y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola a la vez al cuidado de sus animales de ganado vacuno, necesitan un crédito para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, con el objetivo de ampliar su producción agrícola ya que este año los productos subieron de precio, además por las exigencias económicas para su estudio de sus hijos hasta que salgan bachilleres y profesionales, que tengan un futuro mejor , por lo cual se tubo la iniciativa de ir a la zona y facilitar el presente crédito.                                                                                                                                                                                 
El señor Hilario nos cuenta que acudir a las Entidades Financieras le queda muy lejos a la ciudad de Cochabamba y piden muchos requisitos.
texts.en:
Hilario R. C. is 61 years old and he has been married with Felipa Miranda Ledezma for 15 years. They have lived in the community of Primara Canderlaria for 23 years, located north of Colomi. They have 6 children who are dependents and they are in grade school and in high school. 

Hilario and his wife are agriculturists and they also raise cattle. They need the loan to purchase organic fertilizer (chicken fertilizer) and to purchase potatoes seedlings, with the goal of increasing production. This year the products have become more expensive and to pay for the high school and professional training for his children. He wants to give them a better future and it is the reason for the initiative he took to go the region to request a loan. 

Hilario says that requesting loans from other financial institutions requires him to travel very far, to the city of Cochabamba, and they have a great many requisites.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont essentiellement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32  ans et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
HABI T. fait le commerce de pomme de terre dans ce groupe de femmes 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso ville au niveau du rond point central et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en: The group BENKADI has four members who are married women. They all have around 32 year-old and  about 2 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Ouayerma I; one of the popular district of the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their first loan with the microfinance instiution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. In this group of women, Madam Habi T. sells potatoes. She is planning of buying 400Kg of potatoes with the loan. She gets her supplies in the villages near by Sikasso and sells the potatoes with her family at the main market of Sikasso near the main roundabout. Her clients are men and women who pay cash. She plans of making a monthly profit of 32.500CFA. A part will be use to pay off her loan and pay the interests, the other part will be saved.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Clara Gabriela

texts.es:
Clara García de 34 años de edad vive en playas empezó su negocio hace 7 años antes de esto se dedicaba a la cría y venta de pollos, pero porque empezó a sufrir de un problema en las manos por el agua caliente para pelar los pollos. Entonces empezó a vender prendas de vestir, poco a poco ha incrementado su negocio y sus clientes actualmente crían y vende pollos desde hace algunos meses atrás.

Trabaja  todos los días con sus pollos. Con otros artículos dos días a la semana entrega los productos de 2 a 3 días cobra, pero en quincena y fin de mes se dedica más a la cobranza.los hijos le ayudan con la cría de pollos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar pollos y ropa. 

Unos de sus sueños es que desea tener una casa mas cómoda para ella y su familia, más que todos para sus hijos, y en el negocio poner un local en su vivienda para poder vender sus productos incluyendo pollos por libra.
texts.en:
35-year old Clara García lives in Playas, Ecuador. She started her current business seven years ago. Before that, she raised and sold chickens but stopped when she began to have problems with her hands caused by the hot water she used to pluck the chickens.

Clara now earns a living selling clothing and has gradually expanded her business and number of customers. Also, a few months ago, she started raising and selling chickens again. She does this work on a daily basis. She delivers the chickens as well as other items on credit for two or three days. Then every two weeks or at month end she collects the money she is owed. Her children help her with the chickens.

With the loan Clara wants to buy chickens and clothing. One of her dreams is to have a more comfortable house for herself and her family, for her children above all. Another dream is to have a place in her home from which to sell clothing and chicken by weight.

loans.use: to buy chickens, clothing, footwear

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
FANTA T. fait le commerce de pomme de terre à travers le groupe DANAYA.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Sikasso. Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso ville au niveau du rond point central et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The group DANAYA has four members who are married women. They all have around 38 year-old and about 4 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Ouayerma I; one of the popular district of the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their first loan with the microfinance instiution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. In this group of women, Madam Fanta T. sells potatoes. She is planning of buying 400Kg of potatoes with the loan. She gets her supplies in the villages near by Sikasso and sells the potatoes with her family at the main market of Sikasso near the main roundabout. Her clients are men and women who pay cash. She plans of making a monthly profit of 32.500CFA. A part will be use to pay off her loan and pay the interests, the other part will be saved. She wants to increase sales to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio G. es un joven soltero de 40 años que vive con su mamá y su hermana en uno de los   barrios mas alegres y populares de la ciudad de Barranquilla: Carrizal; allí el se dedica a la fabricación de prendas deportivas como  sudaderas, pantalonetas, camisetas etc.  Su negocio inició cuando trabajando en oficios varios en una microempresa cerca a su casa, donde también en sus tiempos libres ayudaba a confeccionar este tipo de ropa, allí fue donde aprendió este arte y el dueño de la microempresa lo entusiasmó, para que siguiera en esta actividad de manera independiente en la que actualmente  se desempeña, aunque con la estructura física  básica para hacerlo, por eso su sueño es dotarlo de maquinarias industriales, que le generen mayor independencia, porque en la actualidad paga por la elaboración de cada prenda.  Su principal desafío era acceder a financiamiento de las instituciones de crédito pero eso es cosa del pasado, porque  esta aplicando a un credikiva que es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el cual construirá su historia financiera, así es que lo aprovechará muy bien y comprará  telas e insumos en mayor cantidad con descuentos especiales, con los cuales fabricará sudaderas y pantalonetas al por mayor, inversión que le augura una recuperación de la inversión con sus respectivas utilidades, porque vende sobre pedidos con una calidad   inigualable  y esto es con lo que el realmente compite.
texts.en:
Sergio G. is 40 years of age, single, and lives with his mother and sister in one of the happiest and popular neighbors in the city of Barraquilla, Carrizal. There he manufactures sportswear such as sweatshirts, shorts, T-shirts, and other items. Sergio started in this trade by working different jobs for a small business near his house. In his free time, he also helped produce this type of clothing. This is how he learned the art of sewing. His employer encouraged him to pursue this business independently and now he has his own operation located in a basic structure. Sergio currently dreams of acquiring industrial machines so that he will be more independent because he currently pays to have each garment produced. His main challenge was being able to access funding from credit institutions, but now that is a thing of the past.

Sergio is requesting a Kiva loan, which is his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This will enable him to build a credit history. He will take advantage of this opportunity to buy fabrics and supplies wholesale so that he can get special discounts. These materials will be used to manufacture sweaters and shorts in mass quantities so that he can generate a return on his investment. Sergio sells his goods according to order. He is able to compete in the marketplace due to the unmatched quality of his products.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & supplies wholesale for manufacturing sportswear

loans.name: Jekafo. Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JEKAFO est constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 35  ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. 
NANA D.   fait le commerce de bois de chauffe dans  ce groupe de femmes JEKAFO. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  4 chargements  de charrettes d’âne dans les villages environnants de Sikasso. Elle les revend sur commande à Hamdallaye et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The group JEKAFO is comprised essentially of married women averaging 35 years of age and three children and living for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members are on their 14th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loans have all been repaid.

Ms. NANA D. has a business involving firewood in this group of women, JEKAFO. She intends to use her loan to buy 4 donkey-cart loads of it in the villages surrounding Sikasso. By special orders, she resells it for cash to a customer base composed of women and men in Hamdallaye and of family members.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA.  Part of the profits will be used for day-to-day family expenses, and the other part will be put into savings. Her ambition is to increase her turnover, so as to satisfy her customers further.

loans.use: Buying firewood

loans.name: Lafia Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe LAFIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. AMI D. fait le commerce de pagnes wax – real et tissus dans ce groupe de femmes LAFIA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  13 pièces de pagnes wax – real et 20kg de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso. Elle les revend au  marché de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 57.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The group LAFIA has five members who are married women. They all have around 38 year-old and about 4 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro; one of the popular district of the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their fourteenth loan with the microfinance instiution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. Their past loans have been paid off. In this group of women, Madam Ami D. sells pagnes wax-real; a printed type of cloth and other cloth. She is planning of buying 13 pieces of pagnes wax-real and 20Kg of cloth with the loan. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's main market and sells at Kamalen Sirakoro's market with her family as an itinerant salesman. Her clients are men and women who pay cash. She plans of making a monthly profit of 57.000CFA. A part will be use to pay her family's daily expenditures, the other part will be saved. She wants to increase sales to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To buy pagnes wax-real, a printed type of cloth and other cloth

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy eggs & hens

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
SABALY est un regroupement de 5 femmes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro, Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur douzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été bien dénoués. MARIETOU S. fait le commerce de poissons dans ce groupe .Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  75kg de poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle les revend au comptant au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à Kamalen Sirakoro à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.000 FCFA dont une partie est épargnée et l’autre utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The group SABALY has five members who are married women. They all have around 42 year-old and about 4 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro district in the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their twelfth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. Their previous loans have been paid off. In this group of women, Madam Marietou S. sells fish to men and women. She is planning on buying 75Kg of fish with the loan. She gets her supplies at Sikasso's main market. She sells fish for cash at Medine's market in Sikasso and with her family in Kamalen Sirakoro. She plans of making a monthly profit of 55.000CFA. A part will be use to pay her family's daily expenditures, the other part will be saved.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Lala Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame LALA LEMOU T. a 47 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs sept  enfants à Noumousso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Kadiolo ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame LALA LEMOU T., fait la commercialisation de boubous bazins  et d’encens il y a plus de 10 ans. Elle mène son activité dans sa famille au quartier Noumousso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits et de sa crédibilité. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a sollicité l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  20 pièces de pagnes bazins(riche – moins riche)  10kg de graines de “magnon kisenin - gueunnin” et 15 bouteilles de parfums à Bamako. Après teinture et couture des pagnes bazins, les boubous sont vendus. De même que les graines et parfums après transformation sont vendus. Elle les vend au comptant et à crédit à Kadiolo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile et de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Madam  Lala Lemou T. is 47 and lives with her husband and their 7 children in Noumousso, one of the popular district of the city of Kadiolo (third administrative region of Mali). Madam  Lala Lemou T. sells boubous bazin (African tunics) and incense for more than 10 years. She set up her family business in the district of Noumousso where her clients really appreciate the quality of her products and her credibility. To meet the needs of her clients which are getting bigger and bigger, she is applying to a loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The loan will allow her to buy 20 pieces of pagnes bazins (a type of cloth), 10Kg of seeds of "magnon Kisenin-gueunnin" and 15 bottles of perfume in Bamako. After dyeing and sewing the pagnes bazins, the boubous are sold. The seeds and perfumes are also sold after being transformed. She sells her products door to door to men and women as an itinerant saleswoman for cash and on credit. She plans of making a monthly profit of 150 000 FCFA thanks to the loan. The loan will be used to grow her business, help with her family's expenditures et pay off her loans and interests.

loans.use: To buy divers articles

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, noodles, soap, matches, and other items

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.
